fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio:
Myself Darshan Madhukar Mahajan, BFA in drawing and painting, postgraduate diploma in Indian aesthetic and Comparative mythology.
My interest lies in mythology, legends and folklores from all over the world. Analysis and theoretical aspects while studying these myths and tales influenced me a lot. Theories of various scholars helped me understand why and how myths or tales are created around the world, how it shapes society and people. Understanding these theories made me appreciate the connection between society, myths and rituals and gave a great understanding and increased acceptance towards everything. The narrative patterns and metaphors, anthropomorphic characters, human behaviour and many more elements attract my attention.  This helps me to construct the hypothesis and further formulates my research. I also try to express this in my artworks too.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio:
Rahul Sanjay Sawant
 (B.F.A. Metal Works, Sir J.J. School of Art, Mumbai)

Awarded Metal artist & founder of Handicrafts' brand
Tamra-kasya ®️ handicrafts

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio: Currently pursuing MFA (product designing) from Sir. JJ School of Art. I've completed my bachelor's in Interior Decoration from JJ itself (2016-2020) batch. Working with traditional Indian style in a contemporary fashion is what I love exploring and experimenting with in my designs. I've been an art journalist for the past 3 years and interaction has been a major part of my professional life which somehow helped me work with tribal artisans as interaction plays a major role here.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio: An artist with qualified experience in visual art, Textile design, printmaking, painting, study and research as well as joint team work has allowed me to develop a strong skill set and unparalleled attention to detail in respective subjects in aesthetics and creative manner.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio:
I have completed my Bachelor’s degree from Sir JJ School of Art, Mumbai in 2018 with the first-class distinction in the University of Mumbai final examination.
I completed my Master's Degree specializing in Portraiture from the same institution in 2020. The mediums in which I primarily work are oil paintings and soft pastels. I recently got awarded the Canadian Elizabeth Greenshields Foundation Grant to further support my art practice as a freelancer.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio: Studied MFA (Metal Work) at Sir J.J. School of Art, Mumbai. Received Gold Medal in 2018. Working in this relevant field since last 8 years. Working on texture and Hindu mythology in the different mediums like copper, brass, aluminium using various techniques like embossing.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio: I am Kapil Balkrishna Sagaonkar from Karad. I completed BFA in interior decoration from sir JJ school of art. Recently I am working on wooden furniture designing and execution.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai
fields.bio: This is Hemant Gavankar. I am a visual artist based in Mumbai. I have completed my BFA (Drawing and Painting) in 2016 and MFA (Portraiture) in 2018, both from Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai. I currently work as a freelancer.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. Istitute of Applied Arts, Mumbai
fields.bio: I am Vivek Gurav, an ambitious illustrator and graphic designer. I am an enthusiastic and self encouraging artist and always learning new skills. Mythology and fantasy are the main topics I like and focus on and come up with new concepts and theories.

fields.college_name: Sir J. J. School of Art, Mumbai

The Chelsea International Fine Art Competition
ALL INDIA ART EXHIBITION 2022- BOMBY ART SOCIETY
Portrayal of the Elephant King Chhadanta
Manifestation and Representation of the Female Form in Art : A Feminist Approach

fields.desc: The Competition is an ideal way to exhibit your talent to a wider international audience. With a distinguished panel of jurors and more than $55,000 in valuable prizes, it is open to visual artists from Asia at any stage of their careers. Painting, sculpture, photography, drawing, mixed media, and print are the accepted mediums.
fields.acceptedMedia: Painting, drawing, sculpture, photography, digital, printing, and mixed media are eligible.
fields.eligibility: The competition is open for Asian, Asian diaspora artists and artists residing in Asia at any stage of their careers.
fields.deadline: All images and entry fees must be received before May 4th 2022.

fields.desc: The Chelsea International Fine Art Competition is an exciting opportunity to show new and innovative work while gaining exposure to an extensive international audience. A distinguished panel of jurors will be awarding more than $70,000 in valuable prizes. The Competition is open to visual artists from around the world at any stage of their career working in painting, sculpture, photography, drawing, mixed media, and print.
fields.acceptedMedia: Painting, drawing, sculpture, photography, digital, printing, and mixed media are eligible.
fields.eligibility: All visual artists worldwide over the age of 18 are eligible to participate.
fields.deadline: All images and entry fees must be received before 9th Nov 202.

fields.desc: As a part of a celebration of ‘75 years of India’s Independence, The Bombay Art Society is organising ‘Colours of Independence: 75 Years of Art’, an online exhibition and symposium starting on 15 August 2021 till 30 Dec 2021. The exhibition is open to Indian Artists. Total 75 awards are to be presented to the best artworks that include 15 Cash Awards of INR.10,000 each and 60 merit certificates. The ‘Certificate of Participation will be presented to all the participating artists. The Entries are to be submitted online at info@bombayartsociety.org
fields.acceptedMedia:
The artworks can be submitted in the following 5 categories.
1. Painting (Includes figurative, abstracts, realistic works, portraits, and landscapes etc) 2. Sculpture   3. Print making (Graphics)   4. Photographic work   5.Video Installation
fields.eligibility: Open to all the artists of Indian nationality including NRIs, working in any style and any medium.
fields.deadline: Entry Fees payment can be done from 07 June 2021 till 30 July 2021. The artworks can be emailed to info@bombayartsociety.org at most by 05 August 2021, 5.00 pm)

fields.desc:
Arnawaz Vasudev Charities a private trust, was set up by S.G. Vasudev following the untimely death of his artist wife Arnawaz in 1988. The principal objectives of the Trust are to promote art education and art activities, and to provide financial assistance to deserving young artists and art students.

The founding trustees are Shanta Guhan, Girish Karnad and S.G. Vasudev.

 

 

For financial assistance/scholarships for art students :

Send a letter of request along with a proposal, an up-to-date biodata, 6 photographs of selected art works, and a statement regarding financial status/needs by post/courier to one of the addresses below:

Contact details:

S.G. Vasudev

Managing Trustee

Arnawaz Vasudev Charities

2/143 Cholamandal Artists’ Village, Injambakkam

Chennai 600 041, India.

E-mail: infoscholarships@vasudevart.com

This scheme focuses on assisting young artists with outstanding promises for advanced training within India.

Offered by: Ministry of Culture, 

Deadline: Varies

Requirements :

  • Indian nationals in the age group of 18 – 25 who have already acquired a degree of proficiency in the chosen field.
  • The fields of Indian Classical Music, Indian Classical Dance, Theatre, Mime, Visual art, Folk, Traditional and Indigenous Arts, and Light Classical Music are covered here.
  • Must have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Guru/Institutes.
  • Candidates should have adequate knowledge in the connected arts/ disciplines.

What it covers: INR 5000 per month for two years

This Scheme seeks to award scholarships to young and deserving upcoming artists including applicants from a visual art background by providing them with a workspace to improve their creative skills and innovative ideas in their respective fields.


A total number of 40 Scholarships will be given during the year 2021-22, subject to the availability of
funds and workspace.


Subjects/Fields in which Scholarships can be awarded


1. Sculpture
2. Painting
3. Ceramic
4. Graphic
5. Art history
6. Art criticism
7. Arts management
8. Art curation and documentation

 

Address: Lalit Kala Akademi, Rabindra Bhavan, 35, Ferozeshah Rd, New Delhi-110001

Contact Phone Number: 011-23009200

Last Date: 30 August 2021

Entry Fee: Rs. 50/-

Selection: The selection will be made by a Jury.

Number of Scholarships: A maximum number of 40 scholarships will be awarded during the academic year 2021-22

Scholarship Duration: The duration and term of the proposed scholarship will be for 12 months (one year).

Work Place: The selected scholars should work only at LKA Regional Centers located in Garhi (New Delhi), Kolkata, Lucknow, Bhubaneswar, Jaipur, Shimla, and Guwahati.

Scholarship Amount: Each scholarship holder will get paid of Rs. 20,000/- pm for one year subject to fulfillment of the criteria. The amount will be transferred directly into the bank account of the beneficiary through NEFT every month.

Eligibility Criteria for Lalit Kala Scholarship 2020-21:

The scholarship award will be given only to those candidates who fulfill all the eligibility criteria.
The students must have an art-related background or Degree/diploma in the field of art or the working experience in visual art for a minimum of 5 years.
Applicants need to work full time on all working days.
Applicants should have an acceptable qualification to continue their scholarship award effectively.
Between 21 to 35 years. Age relaxation is not permissible.
Candidates engaged in a full-time job or any business is not eligible for the scheme scholarship. Those candidates who are pursuing regular studies are also not eligible.
The state/UT in which the candidates have been residing for a minimum of three years will be the State or UT from which he would be deemed to be applying.
Scholars who have already avail Research Grant/Stipend in the past are not eligible.
A scholar should not avail of any other stipend.

How to Apply Lalit Kala Scholarship 2020-21:Students should fill the application forms and send it to the Secretary, Lalit Kala Akademi, Rabindra Bhavan, 35, Ferozeshah Road, New Delhi – 110001. 
 

Students may download the application from LKA official site lalitkala.gov.in.

Required Documents:

  • Passport size photograph
  • Bio-data
  • Copy of Matriculation certificate
  • Photos of artworks
  • Reference letters

Last Date: 30 August 2021is the last date to apply Lalit Kala scholarship scheme.


For more details please see the PDF file given below :

India Government Mint (IGM) Kolkata invites online applications from eligible and willing Indian Citizens for recruitment of Engraver.

 

Age Limit: Engraver-III: 18 to 28 years

Pay Scale: Engraver-III: ₹ 23910 - 85570/- (3rd PRC)

 

Educational Qualifications: Engraver-III:

Bachelor of Fine Arts (Sculpture/ Metal Works/ Painting) with at least 55% marks.

 

Application Fee:

 ₹ 600/- (Non Refundable) per applicant for candidates belonging to Un-reserved, EWS and OBC Categories.

 ₹ 200/- Intimation charges only for SC / ST applicants.

The fee should be made through online payment mode only.

 

How to Apply: Eligible Interested candidates should apply online through IGM Kolkata Online Portal.

The online registration process is now closed, get upcoming updates from the website link given below.

Education in Fine Art/ Applied Arts represents arts dealing with visual beauty and taste like Painting, Sculpture, Metal Work, Textile, Interior Decoration, ceramics and Applied arts. Those who have a passion for fine art and applied art appreciate the beauty and focus on putting things across aesthetically. With the present technological world, novel forms or arts like multimedia, filmmaking and digital art have enabled artists to widen their perspectives. A career in fine/ Applied arts not only involves the study and creation of artwork but also includes business-oriented marketing aspects as well.

 

     Different mediums can be used for the communication of feelings, thoughts and ideas and these might include illustration or sculpting, painting and an assortment of materials like computers, clay, plaster, ink, pen, pencils, pastels, acrylics, watercolours and other mediums.

 

Courses in Fine Arts:

 

     Art as a course at the university or college level typically begins by focusing on the fundamentals of art and most students learn about painting, sculpting, drawing and many other subjects during the first two years of their degree course in fine arts. By the final year of the course, the students are offered the facility of selecting a concentration to focus on in such a way that they can make their career in the selected concentration in the near future. The list of courses that can enable the candidates to choose a career in fine arts is given below.

 

• Four-year Bachelor of Fine Arts and Applied Arts.

 

• Three years advanced diploma in Fashion Designing

 

• Two-year Diploma and one-year certificate course in computer graphics

 

• Two-year diploma in Painting/Textile Designing/Photography

 

• One-year international programme in Visual Arts

 

• Advanced Diploma in Graphic and 3D animation

 

Job prospects and job openings in the field of fine arts:

 

     Candidates with a degree in Fine Arts / Applied arts can find job placements in organizations working in the following industries:

 

• Textile

 

• Film and theatre productions

 

• Teaching

 

• Graphic arts

 

• Visualizing professional

 

Professionals in fine arts have many avenues open based on their perseverance, personality and talent.

 

     Thus, fine art is a field that not only makes the learner enthusiastic and happy but also offers the Freelancing career and a wide range of future job prospects not only in private organizations but in government organizations as well and they can enjoy a lucrative and satisfactory job prospectus.

MAH-AAC-CET releases application forms for the exam on the official website mahacet.org. Candidates seeking admission to undergraduate Fine Art And Applied Art can check the important information about the entrance exam from this page. Candidates aspiring to get good scores must have good knowledge of the syllabus, exam pattern. Here, check here the complete MAH AAC CET syllabus and question papers with answers.

 

Practical & Theory Subjects 

 

  • Paper-I – Object Drawing Practical 

 

  • Paper-II – Design Practical

 

  • Paper-III – General Knowledge

 

  • Paper-IV- Memory Drawing Practical

 

 

Mode of exam – The exam is held in both Online and offline mode.

Medium – The language of the exam is English.

Marking Scheme – For every correct 1 mark is allotted (general knowledge) and there is no negative marking.

Visva Bharati University

KALA BHAVAN :

(Institute of Fine Arts)

 

Visva Bharati University was founded by the first non-European Nobel Laureate Rabindranath Thakur (popularly known as Tagore) in 1921. Visva-Bharati is a pilgrimage for education and culture. It reflects the Tagorean ethos of making a complete human being. Visva Bharati University offers various Under Graduate (UG), Post Graduate (PG), M.Phil. and PhD courses under various specialisations giving the students a pool of options for undertaking higher studies. The admission procedure for all the UG and PG courses generally starts in May and ends in the third week of June. Admission for most of the courses is done based on the merit of the students. 

 

 KALA BHAVANA

(Institute of Fine Arts)

 

  • Undergraduate :  52 (6 Seats earmarked for Diploma in Fine Arts)

 

  • Post Graduate/Advanced Diploma :  97 Seats.

Admission in BFA / History of Art :

 

Kala Bhavana ( Institute of Fine Arts) :

( Honours - 4 years: 1 year Foundation & 3 years Specialization )

 

Subject :

  • Painting 
  • Mural 
  • Sculpture
  • Graphic Art 
  • Design (Textiles/ Ceramics)
  • History of Art

Eligibility criteria :

School leaving certificate/ Madhyamik of Visva-Bharati or equivalent with at least 65% marks and necessary aptitude.

 

Admission in MFA / Advanced Diploma :

 

For eligibility of admission in MFA / Advanced Diploma, 55% marks or its equivalent grade is the minimum required criteria for Admission in BFA /DIP 4 year Course. If results not published of selected candidates then the candidates should collect the Confidential Reports (B.F.A./Diploma result) from the concerned authority and submit to the Principal, Kala Bhavana, before admission.

   Candidate applying for MFA (Hons.)/Advanced Diploma should send 5 photos of his/her art works attested by the respective principal along with the application form.

             On the basis of this documents a primary selection of the candidates for MFA (Hons.)/Advanced Diploma will be made and only those short listed candidates shall be called for Entrance Test (practical, theoretical & viva-voce).

       Final list of the selected candidates for MFA (Hons.)/Advanced Diploma will be displayed at the Nandan office and uploaded in the University website beside intimation individually.

Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda

fine arts

 

Fine Art Admission for Under/Post Graduation 

 

The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda - Faculty of Fine Arts is dedicated to the education of professional artists and scholars of the history and theory of art. The emphasis is laid on the creative identity of students and teachers to foster an approach to the study and practice of art that is inquiring, experimental and research-minded. 

The major subject areas are Painting, Sculpture, Applied Art and Graphic Arts which have a constructive and interactive relationship. The Faculty also offers research facilities in every area, leading to PhD The University Grants Commission has honoured the Faculty with the prestigious Special Assistance Programme.

 

 

 

Undergraduate (B.V.A) and Diploma

 

  • Painting
  • Applied arts
  • Sculpture 
  • Art History and Aesthetics ( Degree Programme)

 

MVA/Post Diploma in Painting

 

  • Creative Painting
  • Mural Design

 

MVA/Post Diploma in Sculpture

 

  • Creative Sculpture
  • Ceramic Sculpture
  • Metal Casting
  • Wood Carving
  • Stone Carving
  • Monumental Sculpture
  • Portraiture



 

MVA/Post Diploma in Applied Arts

 

  • Visualization
  • Illustration

 

MVA/Post Diploma in Graphic Arts (Printmaking)

 

M.A. (Fine) in Museology

 

One Year In-service Post-Graduate Diploma in Museology

 

The following tests will be conducted for the Entrance exam

 

Bachelor of visual art  (B.V.A)

 

And Diploma in Painting, Sculpture and Applied Arts

1. General Knowledge (Written paper in English)

2. Drawing

3. Aptitude for Applied Arts

4. Clay Modeling (for Sculpture Students only)

5. Design and Colour

6. Personal Interview (for shortlisted candidates only)

 

B.V.A. Art History and Aesthetics

1. General Knowledge

2. Language Proficiency Test

3. Personal Interview

 

  Preparation:-  

 

  • Students should read about famous artists and art movements from the past and they must be aware of the current affairs/ General knowledge for the theory examination.
  • Students need to be good observant/ determined as the theory paper also comes with few observation tests and also few writing skills in English for the English test. (For theory exam) 
  • The student should be good at drawing and sketches with good visual capabilities for students applying for painting/ sculpture/applied arts.
  • Painting students must be good at visual thinking as the topic will be given on the time.
  • Students applying for applied arts must study basic Graphic designing (Logos and others)
  • Sculptures students should know basic modelling for the aptitude test.​​​​​​​

 

     MSU Fine Arts suggest to all students that their portfolio must be strong. Because of Pandemic, there are very low chances of conducting a physical exam, So Theory will be conducted online. If a student qualifies 1st round of the theory test then, there will be an interview which he/she must pass to get admitted..!!

 

 

Fee structure :

 

After the submitting form, Further information will be provided accordingly through Mail for both the students applying for UG/PG programme. Students must select the department as per their choice and fill the admission form within the given due date.

 

Contact details :

Sayajibaug Main Road

Nr. Kalaghoda Circle

Baroda 390002, Gujrat, India.

Phone: 912652795520

Email: econtact-ffa@msubaroda.ac.in
